= Introduction =

Pokkare is a J2EE program that utilizes Apache Struts 2 as the MVC web framework & Hibernate as the database framework. The database is MySQL and the program is run on an Apache Tomcat server.

Pokkare is meant to be used in maintaining and viewing scores from home poker games. Scores are assigned per tournament according to the players rank in tournament. Players, games, and scores (ranks) must be saved and viewable in a comprehensive form.

= Requirements =

== 1 Add new games ==
1.1) New games shall be addable. 
1.2) A game has a host (one of the players), a date and a description. 
1.3) To keep score of games on account of multiple games on a single date, a running number starting from 1 shall be automatically affixed to each game. 
1.4) First game entered for a given date shall be number 1, second game number 2 etc.

== 2 Add scores to game ==
2.1) Scores shall be addable to games. 
2.2) Only ranking of players shall be recorded. 
2.3) Points for each position are to be gotten from the database. 
2.4) Ranking must be attached to a game.

== 3 Add and delete players ==
3.1) Players shall be addable and deletable from the database. 
3.2) Players are distinguished by their name. 
3.3) The maximum length of a player's name is 100 characters long. 
3.4) Two players with the same name shall not be addable, regardless of state (see .

3.5) Players shall be deletable from the database by using their name. 
3.6) If a player is removed, it shall not be removed from the database. Instead, the database shall have a state field for this player indicating the deletion. 
3.7) Score related information for this player is discarded while calculating ranking and scores.
3.8) Other data, such as game host data, is left intact, functionality shall be the same as for an not-delete player.

== 4 Show ranking ==
4.1) Ranking of players in the statistics shall be presented for each player graphically and numerically as per 4.2) and 4.3).
4.2) Totals shall be presented numerically 
4.3) Score per game shall be presented in a graph.

== Environment requirements == 
Pokkare is required to be fully useable* on the following environments: Windows XP Service pack 3, Linux Release XYZ, Mac OS X Leopard, with the following browsers: Opera 9.64, Firefox 3.0.7.

*Fully useable means all functionality listed in this document under requirements are fully operational.
